website_summaries.verdict: Brooks markets the Glycerin 14 as one of its flagship neutral and ultra-cushioned shoes. Although it does not match the truly max cushioned shoes of other brands, it does have a near pillowy cushioning and is substantially lighter than many of the competition. It offers excellent arch support, very supportive, and continues to deliver a flexible ride that belies the amount of cushioning. The shoe is quite light for 10Ks to mid-distance runs at moderate speed and packs enough cushioning for those who love to pile on the miles.
pros: The sock-like fit and plush interior combine for an ultra-comfortable ride in the Glycerin 14, according to most of the reviews
The highly-cushioned midsole muffles the force of impact
It is almost an ounce lighter than the previous model
The traction is great, based on the observations of several runners
The arch support is exceptional for a neutral trainer, according to some
It offers noticeable flexibility despite the heavy cushioning, as remarked by more than a handful
The 14th edition of the Glycerin is extensively used by many for workouts as well
A handful of runners really liked the shoe’s capacity to accommodate orthotics
The cushioning is adequately responsive, based on the experience of some runners
A good number of runners were impressed by the Glycerin 14’s durability
cons: Several Glycerin fans were disappointed with the tighter fit
It runs a bit small, according to a few
A few users noted a squeaking sound when running in the latest version of the Glycerin
The tongue is just too padded for a small group of runners

customer_reviews.title: Happy but... read my comment
customer_reviews.text: Glue showing in both shoes, between the sole and the point of the toes, something definitely not expected from such an expensive shoes and well known brand. It looks like they are going to unglue soon :( I hope they will not!
customer_reviews.author: Alessandra

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed about these runners as the grips on the sole have come away!
customer_reviews.author: donna murdock

customer_reviews.title: Slippery when wet
customer_reviews.text: I switched to Brooks for the wider toe box (compared to my previous manufacturer). They are slightly small; I needed to go up half size. Very comfortable- the only thing I don’t like (hence 4 stars) is that the sole compound provides far less grip when the roads are damp / wet. Fine when it’s dry.
customer_reviews.author: Unpredictable

customer_reviews.title: Lovely supportive comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on the advice of my podiatrist as I have insertional achilles tendinopathy. My orthotics fit nicely inside and the shoes are supportive and comfortable. After years of pain, I am finally on the mend. I were them pretty much all the time, not just for exercise. The colours are beautiful too and they look great with jeans.
customer_reviews.author: JuggerMort

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes, perfect for people with high arched feet, but I had been fitted properly and recommended by a retail specialist, so I knew this brand suited me. Super comfortable and very supportive, a little bright and blingy, but a small concession for such a great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: R. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Confortable and food cushioning
customer_reviews.text: Good cushioning and comfortable fit for wide feet. Design ( Pink) looks stylish and adds looking of qualify, but still is not too conspicuous. Feels conformable in terms of shock absorption on short road runs. Will update in next few months re durability
customer_reviews.author: Magpie

customer_reviews.title: I love these trainers
customer_reviews.text: I love these trainers, after trying different shoes for running these are the ones I will keep on buying, the grip and support are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Ty Powell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had before and comfortable on first wearing. Used for Tennis and give great support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: they are so comfortable and brilliant for road running
customer_reviews.text: I loves these shoes. they are so comfortable and brilliant for road running. I am normally a size 5 but had to get a size 6 to get the right fit so definitely go up a size when buying.
customer_reviews.author: Kylie H.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love these trainers, they support my feet well and were immediately comfy without having to wear them in . They feel very springy to run in . This is my fourth pair of Brooks
customer_reviews.author: Clare O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Soo comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I just love these Brooks! Hence buying two pairs as not easy to get hold of now.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger feet

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. Look great and so comfortable. Great cushioning
customer_reviews.author: Hilary Brimacombe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent running shoes able to run as soon as put on no rubbing at all. Love Brooks shoes
customer_reviews.author: a fry/j wright

product_meta.title: Brooks Women's Glycerin 14 Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Glycerine 14 this shoe is ideal for the quick run. It is very light and supports the foot very well. Thanks to full-length Brooks dna this sports shoe offers an optimum damping and is equipped with all to guarantee stability and comfort. • great dna-middle sole for adaptive damping • 3D stretch print offers strategical mixture of stretch and structure for a perfect fit • ideally pressure zones intercept the impact • conformable saddle • soft inside material
feature_bullets: Super DNA with a co-molded Cush Stack and a fully articulated outsole: Ultimate Plush Ride
Stretch TPU Cage with dynamic fit gullies and a molded tongue: Dynamic mid-foot capture
